channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Several black bags dumped next to bins, 26th June
item.description:
Address details are for flats associated with 36 Bloomfield Road, but the offence is located on Cambridge Row by the corner.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Cambridge Row, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Damage, animal abuse, fouling, 26th June
item.description:
Again, I'm reporting this as nothing appears to be happening. Today there were two kids and three horses (again) in the field. The kids were hitting the horses and hanging from their manes trying to climb on. The horses were extremely panicked. The new tress that you planted are all damaged as they tie horses to them all day- despite the weather with no food or water. There is excrement everywhere. I reported this months ago- you've done absolutely nothing about it

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crayford Way, Barnes Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti needs removing here please, 26th June
item.description:
Graffiti needs removing here please.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 108, Eltham High Street, Well Hall, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Garage 25-32, 26th June
item.description:
Due to bad hygiene practices of premier food shop at 12 dunton road, & their refusal to adhere to correct trade waste & recycling procedures, premier waste is left littering the entire area. parking bays, road and pathways remain littered with the premier shop trade waste. estate cleaner should not have to use his time cleaning up after the traders at this property. the area is unsightly, unhygenic and adding to the already overwhelming pest (rats) activity. this area hasnt been cleaned in weeks. rats are eating the underside of vehilcles costing £1000s in repairs. please ensure the area is cleaned before marking as fixed. many job requests in the area are being marked as fixed when they are not.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Setchell Road, Old Kent Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside 53 Goodge Street, 26th June
item.description:
Some of the tiles in the pavement are loose. This creates both a trip hazard but it also causes customers at the coffee shop to spill all their coffee as the tables at the outdoor seating move and wobble as pedestrians walk past. The issue has been present for over a year.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 53, Goodge Street, Fitzrovia, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: This single bin is constantly overflowing, 26th June
item.description:
This bin overflows every other day. Can it please be emptied more regularly, or could a second bin be installed? Thanks for looking into this.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1-3, Mill Street, Bermondsey, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bikes are being loaded and unloaded outside the designated area, 26th June
item.description:
This activity is causing obstruction and may pose safety risks or inconvenience to bin collection and other vehicles. It is important that all loading and unloading of bikes be carried out strictly within the specified zones to ensure order and compliance with site regulations.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Bailey, City of London

item.title: Overhanging foliage from a property on the junction of Valliers Wood Road and Halfway Street, 26th June
item.description:
Overhanging foliage from a property on the junction of Valliers Wood Road and Halfway Street - it was previously reported in March - Ref; 7329442 resident is worried this is going to cause an accident as its really restricting views for motorists - please can this be looked in to
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1A, Valliers Wood Road, Longlands, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish everywhere as usual, 26th June
item.description:
Is there anybody morning the reports on page at all, please? Rubbish everywhere as usual at this spot at 149 Lee Road without any effective actions in place by the council to stop the repetitive fly-tipping. When is it being resolved, please? It’s not about cleaning only but understand the root causes in order to stop this awful behaviour from whoever that is. Thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lee Road, Horn Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet
